Class Player

java.lang.Object
Player
public class Player extends Object
-----------------------------------------------------
Assignment 0
COMP249
Question: Part 1
Written by: Evan Teboul, 40238390
Due date: February 3 2023
-----------------------------------------------------
This class contains all the attributes of the player like the name of the player (name), their coordinates on the board (row and column), whether they start first or second (row,column) and the number of the square they are in (position)
Author:
Evan Teboul

      public int getPosition()

      public int getplayerNb()

      Returns:
      playerNb is the order number of the player i.e. player with playerNb = 1, starts the game

    • setRow

      public void setRow(int row)
      this method sets the row number, which is important for identifying the row in the board array.
      Parameters:
      row - this is the horizontal component on the board.

    • setColumn

      public void setColumn(int column)
      this method sets the row number, which is important for identifying the column in the board array.
      Parameters:
      column - this is the vertical coordinate on the board.

    • setPlayerNb

      public void setPlayerNb(int playerNb)
      sets the player number, which is used in the whoStarts method. player with "playerNb" == 1 will start.
      Parameters:
      playerNb - this is the of the player turns, i.e. playerNb = 1, is the player who starts first

    • whoStarts

      public static Player whoStarts(Player p1, Player p2)
      This method is static so it does not have to be used on any object, it just requires two inputs. The players that are placed as a parameters will each take turns rolling, the person with a higher dice roll will then be assigned a playerNb of 1, in its attribute, "playerNb", which will later be used to identify the player who starts the game. The player with the smaller dice roll will receive a player of 2, so they will start their turn after the other player. The number of attempts is also recorded and is reported once the starting player is determined.
      Parameters:
      p1 - this is a Player object
      p2 - this is a Player object
      Returns:
      this method returns the Player object that will start the game, meaning the player that will start each turn and roll first.

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
